basicInfo.parentCompany: Akamai Technologies (acquired for $900M in March 2022; Akamai trades as NASDAQ: AKAM)
basicInfo.notes: Founded in 2003 by Christopher Aker in New Jersey. Bootstrapped with no outside funding until acquisition. Originally based in Linwood, NJ, moved to Philadelphia 2015. Acquired by Akamai Technologies for $900M in March 2022. Rebranded as Akamai Connected Cloud in 2023. Now benefits from Akamai's global edge network and DDoS protection infrastructure. Expanded from 11 to 25+ data centers post-acquisition.

pricing.moneyBackExclusions: 7-day unconditional refund guarantee for compute services; Hourly billing allows pay-as-you-go; Can cancel anytime

serverPerformance.ddosProtectionLevel: Akamai-powered DDoS protection included on all plans

securitySsl.sslProvider: Self-managed (Let's Encrypt recommended) or NodeBalancer SSL termination

policiesOverages.bandwidthOveragePolicy: Transfer pooled across all Linodes (1TB-20TB depending on plan); $0.005/GB additional egress
policiesOverages.storageOveragePolicy: Pay for additional Block Storage volumes
policiesOverages.accountSuspensionPolicy: Violation of ToS; fraud detection; non-payment; abuse reports
policiesOverages.resourceAbuseDefinition: Network abuse; spam; illegal content; excessive resource consumption affecting other users
policiesOverages.hiddenFeesNotes: No renewal markup (flat-rate billing); Backups are paid add-on (~20% of compute cost); NodeBalancers $10/month each; Object Storage priced per GB; All pricing transparent and predictable

contentRestrictions.gamblingNotes: Legal gambling allowed per US laws
contentRestrictions.proxyVpnNotes: TOR nodes technically allowed but practically difficult due to abuse complaints

business.affiliateCommissionAmount: $100 per new customer who stays active 90+ days; 90-day cookie; Referral program: $25 credit when referee spends $25

editorial.knownIssues: Low Trustpilot rating (2.0/5) with many complaints about account verification/cancellation; Price increases post-Akamai acquisition; Some report worse support quality after acquisition; Aggressive fraud detection leads to false positives; No managed WordPress; Limited compared to hyperscalers for enterprise features; Some legacy features deprecated
editorial.bestFor: Developers wanting reliable infrastructure with phone support; Teams needing Akamai edge network integration; Users valuing predictable flat-rate pricing; Kubernetes users (LKE); Users needing 24/7 phone support (rare for cloud providers); Long-term Linux users comfortable with unmanaged hosting
editorial.avoidIf: Need managed WordPress hosting; Want included cPanel; Beginner requiring hand-holding; Need included email hosting; Budget-sensitive (prices increased post-acquisition); Concerned about recent support quality decline; Need extensive global coverage (fewer locations than competitors)
editorial.competitorComparisonNotes: Higher entry price ($5) than Vultr ($2.50) or DigitalOcean ($4); 24/7 phone support (unique among major cloud competitors); Akamai DDoS protection superior to standalone competitors; Good G2 rating (4.6) but poor Trustpilot (2.0); Flat-rate predictable pricing unlike usage-based competitors; 25 locations fewer than Vultr (32) but growing; Strong Kubernetes offering (LKE); 99.99% SLA matches industry standard

comparisonData.uniqueSellingPoint: Only major cloud provider with 24/7 phone support, backed by Akamai's global edge network and DDoS protection
comparisonData.idealCustomerProfile: Developer or business wanting reliable cloud infrastructure with phone support and enterprise-grade DDoS protection

faqContent.faqIsThisHostGood: Linode (now Akamai) is excellent for developers wanting reliable cloud infrastructure with 24/7 phone support. Strong G2 rating (4.6) but Trustpilot rating (2.0) reflects signup/verification frustrations.
faqContent.faqWhoOwnsThisHost: Linode was acquired by Akamai Technologies for $900M in March 2022. Akamai is a publicly traded company (NASDAQ: AKAM) known for its CDN and security services.
faqContent.faqHowMuchDoesItCost: Linode starts at $5/month for a 1GB Shared CPU instance. Dedicated CPU plans start at $36/month. Pricing is flat-rate and predictable with no surprise charges.
faqContent.faqIsItBeginnerFriendly: Partially. While unmanaged, Linode has excellent documentation and 24/7 phone support (rare for cloud providers). Beginners with some technical interest can learn.
faqContent.faqDoesItIncludeEmail: No, Linode does not include email hosting. You must set up your own mail server or use third-party email services.
faqContent.faqCanIHostWordPress: Yes, with one-click WordPress installation available. However, it's unmanaged - you handle security updates, optimization, and maintenance yourself.
faqContent.faqWhatsTheUptime: Linode guarantees 99.99% uptime for compute services with SLA credits if uptime falls below this. Non-compute services have 99.9% SLA.
faqContent.faqCanICancelAnytime: Yes, with hourly billing and a 7-day unconditional money-back guarantee. You can destroy instances anytime with no contracts.
